annotation.spannedText: Practise safe sex

annotation.spannedText: Avoid sharing intravenous drug equipment

annotation.spannedText: Wear gloves when exposed to blood or body fluids

annotation.spannedText: Clear up blood or body fluids, using warm water and detergent

annotation.spannedText: Ensure surgical instruments are disposable or adequately sterilised

annotation.spannedText: Ensure surgical instruments are disposable or adequately sterilised. Handle 'sharps' safely

annotation.spannedText: Wear goggles if there is risk of infected material splashing into the eye

annotation.spannedText: Do not permit healthcare workers who are positive for hepatitis B antigen to work in areas where they could be a risk to others

annotation.spannedText: It should not be given into the buttock

annotation.spannedText: Adults and children considered at very high risk should also have an accelerated schedule

annotation.spannedText: it is recommended that individuals at continuing risk of infection should be offered a single booster dose of vaccine, once only, around five years after primary immunisation

classMention.mentionClass: it is recommended that individuals at continuing risk of infection should be offered a single booster dose of vaccine, once only, around five years after primary immunisation

annotation.spannedText: Antibody titres should be checked one to four months after the completion of a primary course of vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Antibody titres should be checked one to four months after the completion of a primary course of vaccine

annotation.spannedText: They should then receive the reinforcing booster dose at five years

annotation.spannedText: They should then receive the reinforcing dose at five years

classMention.mentionClass: They should then receive the reinforcing dose at five years

annotation.spannedText: Antibody levels should be monitored annually and if they fall below 10 mIU/mL, a booster dose of vaccine should be given to patients who have previously responded to the vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Antibody levels should be monitored annually and if they fall below 10 mIU/mL, a booster dose of vaccine should be given to patients who have previously responded to the vaccine

annotation.spannedText: Booster doses should also be offered to any haemodialysis patients who are intending to travel to high-risk countries if they have previously responded to the vaccine, especially if they are to receive haemodialysis and have not received a booster in the preceding 12 months

annotation.spannedText: The two should be given in different sites

classMention.mentionClass: The two should be given in different sites

annotation.spannedText: It should be given ideally within 48 hours but no later than seven days after exposure

classMention.mentionClass: It should be given ideally within 48 hours but no later than seven days after exposure

annotation.spannedText: the vaccine should not be delayed whilst awaiting blood test results

classMention.mentionClass: the vaccine should not be delayed whilst awaiting blood test results

annotation.spannedText: If the site of exposure is a 'needlestick' injury, cut or abrasion, the site should be washed immediately with soap and water

classMention.mentionClass: If the site of exposure is a 'needlestick' injury, cut or abrasion, the site should be washed immediately with soap and water

annotation.spannedText: All babies with seropositive mothers should have the full primary course of hepatitis B immunisation and most should also have HBIG within 24 hours of birth in addition

classMention.mentionClass: All babies with seropositive mothers should have the full primary course of hepatitis B immunisation and most should also have HBIG within 24 hours of birth in addition

annotation.spannedText: All babies weighing less than 1500 g born to infected mothers should have HBIG as well as primary immunisation

classMention.mentionClass: All babies weighing less than 1500 g born to infected mothers should have HBIG as well as primary immunisation

annotation.spannedText: Reactions and side-effects are rare

classMention.mentionClass: Reactions and side-effects are rare

annotation.spannedText: Live vaccines should not be given within three months of administering HBIG, as it may interfere with development of immunity (other than yellow fever)
